Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: M. Morton
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am not an iPhone or Apple faithful. I use products based on how well they perform and suit my needs. This phone blows away the others. I had an iPhone 3, then switched to an HTC Android, then the Droid Razr. Now I'm back to the iPhone again. I like the clarity of the screen, which helps when reading text with these old eyes. The Facetime feature is great and the Verizon LTE is super fast. The screen and all of the apps are much more responsive than the iPhone 3 or any of the Android devices I've had. I'm sure another stunning Android phone will come around and I will just as likely switch again. For now, the iPhone 5 performs at every level.

Reviews.Title: A lot of good and few bad.
Reviews.Author: MD
Reviews.Content: The shipping was rather quick (though I did pay extra for expedited), it came in a padded envelope rather than a box and without the IPhone box itself (which i don't understand as the item is listed as brand new) in addition with a charger stuffed in there, both the cable and solid wall charger which could have ended up badly. A bit more caution should have been taken in my opinion. The listing also said "accessories" which was false as the headphone that come with the phone were not included costing me another $32 after tax. However, when I received the phone all things seem in working order and had no issue activating it with my Verizon carrier. So far it seems to be in flawless condition visually and operationally. I shall update if anything happens with in. All and all I am happy with my purchase and will consider buying from this seller again.

Reviews.Content: What can I say about the iPhone 5? My wife attempted upgrade from 4 with this Amazon seller and we received a defective phone. Be VERY careful with "refurbished", or "loose" (not in box and sealed) phones.Beware THIS seller in particular: "Quag's Buy, Sell, Trade."

Apple has discontinued the 5, so we might run into issues later. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: Amazon screwed this one up
Reviews.Author: Pinchvalve
Reviews.Content: The product was as described, no worries there.  The seller was 100% with the listing and the item was as 100% described.  EXCELLENT condition, everything works, thank you for the great item.The problem was that I was looking for an iPhone 5c.  Amazon WILL NOT limit searches to what you actually want, they throw in all this other stuff.  So while sifting through listings, it is easy to jump from one model to the next without ever realizing it.  I filtered on a 5c with accessories from Verizon and picked this one from the results.  It was a regular 5 with no accessories.Yes, had I read the listing more closely I would have realized, or the order confirmation.  But I was looking at a FILTERED list and assumed that Amazon know how to conduct a basic filtered list and I was busy at the time of order and didn't properly read everything.  So DO NOT trust the check boxes off to the left, they don't necessarily filter or include what you want and READ everything closely before you One Click Order!The phone was in such good shape, I decided to just keep it rather than attempt a return.  The seller did nothing wrong and I did not want to bother the seller with my mistakes.  Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: NOT A VERIZON WIRELESS PHONE
Reviews.Author: Joseph My Castle
Reviews.Content: I specifically searched for an iphone 5 for Verizon Wireless. Verizon will not accept any phones that are "jail broke" or another carrier, they MUST be issued to Verizon. Well the title to this iphone said "verizon wirelss". I will say the phone arrived quick and looked perfect, not a scratch on it. It powered up fine. But when we headed to Verizon to have the service turned on we were told that this phone is NOT VERIZON and it basically a $380 paper weight that we cannot do anything with. I walked over to a tablet and logged in to file a dispute and get a refund, we have YET to hear from the seller on what will get done to fix this situation.

Reviews.Title: can't talk and surf on the Iphone 5 via Verizon
Reviews.Author: Dwight
Reviews.Content: If your internet illiterate mother calls you and needs you to look something up on the web pronto - you have to tell her, "hang up and call you back" because Verizon's Iphone 5 won't let you do those two things that "inferior" Android phones allow you to do because the latter have two separate antennas to do allow data and voice to work at the same time.  So much for Iphone being the luxury ne plus ultra classiest of all smartphones.  Just as Apple won't give us removable memory or batteries, they didn't give us two separate antennas for the Iphone 5.  I'm not sure if the older iphones have two antennas.FYI if this is a deal breaker for you.  How much is retina display really worth then?On the plus side, this phone at one year old is holding its own in new reviews of the Samsung Galaxy S4 with one article asking if you prefer Brains (Iphone) or Brawn (Samsung).The best thing about the Iphones is that despite the walled garden layout, its IOS updates are guaranteed regardless of your phone model so you will never be shut out because you own a two year old phone.  I have read numerous announcements about older model Android phones that won't get the latest update because the manufacturer can't be bothered to write the necessary modifications for a no longer topselling model.  Sucks right?the best thing about this phone compared to the androids is the apps, the feeling that you are in the loop when you read something in the media about smartphones as opposed to if you owned an Android or a Blackberry and you have to wonder gee I wonder if they make a version for my phone.  With an Iphone, you know the answer is of course.Memory cannot be expanded nor removed so if your phone dies, you lose the extra memory you may have paid for.If the only thing wrong with your phone is that you've blown out the battery.  You are SOL.  A dead battery means you don't even get to keep the phone as an ipod for your car music.Things to bear in mind about whether to go with this year old phone:1080p resolution is going to be the minimum in the future (comparable to retina display) as  will a quad-core processor and everyone else is offering more powerful battery life.I really think that Apple should have dropped the price of this phone to $99 then the IOs and Apps advantage would have taken away the temptation to spend for the latest and greatest.Wireless charging is also going to be available on future models.
